hybrid_architecture.title: CNN-Transformer Hybrid Architecture
hybrid_architecture.description: Combine ResNet-50 for local multi-scale feature extraction with Transformer for global context and long-range dependencies

data_enhancement.title: Customized Data Enhancement
data_enhancement.description: Use random flips, rotation, and color jittering to improve data diversity and model robustness

cross_attention.title: Bidirectional Cross-Attention Mechanism
cross_attention.description: Implement multi-level cross-attention modules to achieve deep dynamic interaction and fusion between local features and global information

explainable_ai.title: Multi-dimensional Explainable AI
explainable_ai.description: Use Grad-CAM++ and attention map visualization techniques to align AI focus points with clinical diagnostic logic, solving the "black box" problem

faq.title: FAQ
faq.description: Find answers to commonly asked lung cancer detection questions

general.question: What is the main purpose of this research project?
general.answer: The project aims to develop a smart auxiliary diagnosis system for lung cancer X-ray images based on a CNN-Transformer hybrid model to improve the accuracy and efficiency of early diagnosis. It addresses the limitations of traditional X-ray diagnosis, such as missed diagnoses of small lesions and the difficulty of analyzing complex images.

general.question: What are the expected outcomes of this project?
general.answer: The expected outcomes include one scientific research paper and a comprehensive summary report containing experimental results and interpretability analysis.The system aims to assist clinical doctors by reducing missed diagnosis rates and optimizing medical efficiency.

features.question: How does the hybrid model architecture work?
features.answer: The system utilizes a "dual-stream architecture": a CNN stream (based on ResNet-50) extracts local multi-scale features, while a parallel Transformer stream captures global context and long-range dependencies. These streams interact dynamically through a bidirectional cross-attention mechanism to fuse features before classification.

features.question: Is the system's decision-making process interpretable?
features.answer: Yes, the project integrates Explainable AI (XAI) techniques. It uses Grad-CAM++ to visualize the CNN stream's focus on local lesions and attention maps to show the Transformer's global context focus. This aligns the model's "focus points" with clinical diagnostic logic to solve the "black box" problem.

technical.question: What datasets and data processing methods are used?
technical.answer: The project uses Kaggle public datasets (IQ-OTH/NCCD, LungCancer4Types, etc.) containing normal, benign, and malignant images. Data processing includes resizing, normalization, and augmentation strategies like random flips and rotation, with a 70% training, 15% validation, and 15% testing split.

technical.question: What is the technical implementation environment?
technical.answer: The model is implemented using Python and deep learning frameworks, utilizing the Adam optimizer and a weighted cross-entropy loss function.The training process involves five-fold cross-validation to ensure generalization and support GPU acceleration for computation.
